page.title: 09LAND USE CONFLICT
page.content: { The area's nearness to Coventry is {the main cause of conflict within the {area.}As visitors to the area have differing views over how to use the land than do the farmers. The city seems to be constantly growing outwards putting ever increasing pressure on the land. Townspeople look to their rural surrounds to provide them with high class commuter housing, land for new industrial estates and land for recreation. While farmers see towns as a threat to their livelihood. There are also areas that are protected as nature reserves; these reserves restrict the farmer still further yet are only open to the few for recreation. { Land is always under pressure but {land that is close to cities is under {greater pressure.
